title: Integer overflow and memory corruption in WebSocketChannel
description: From if payloadLength64 return NS ERROR FILE TOO BIG payloadLength64 is taken from the incoming frame and thus attacker while is the total size of all previous belonging to the current message The check to ensure that no incoming message is ever than which itself is at most INT32 MAX However The check is incorrect due to the of the int64 t payloadLength64 uint32 t int32 t According to the arithmetic conversion and will be converted to int64 t before the comparison As such the comparison is and will evaluate to false if the sum becomes negative This can be as Send a fragment of size X where X is less than Send a second fragment of size 0x7fffffffffffffff The sum will then become negative and the check What then uint32 t static cast uint32 t payloadLength64 if avail break will be 0xffffffff and so will defer of the message until this many have been received Incoming data is thus internally until a whole message been received does this Let s see what there else buffer is not sufficient extend it count mBufferSize3 LOG update read buffer extended to un uint8 t old uint8 t if old return false old buffer count The buffer will be multiple times However at some point count mBufferSize3 will overflow resulting in actually shrinking the array The following will then write data at a known offset from the new buffer Attached is an file and a python script The file up the connection while the python script a simple server and the malicious once a client is connected To reproduce start the python script on and open via file The python script should start printing progress information and at some point the browser will crash The at the time of the crash Process stopped thread tid 0x206a90 0x00007fff882ed01c libsystem platform platform memmove VARIANT name title: CSP frame ancestors should not compare paths per CSP
description: This bug was initially as a clone of a class bz bug link bz status NEW show bug id title NEW Bug a See a class bz bug link bz status NEW show bug id c5 title NEW bug comment a and a class bz bug link bz status NEW show bug id c9 title NEW bug comment a with in frame and against those This is actually correct according to if you follow the of host source but I don t think that was intentional frame was intended to be a better X Frame which only on This a cross origin leak though and in the latest spec frame is explicitly defined as being only origin based

title: Pocket extension unnecessarily exposes its messaging interface to web pages
description: Note I am this issue here rather than to Pocket because Pocket is an integral part of and cannot be disabled or removed by regular The bubble displayed by the Pocket button is actually an loading from either about pocket or about pocket saved In order to communicate with that frame the Pocket extension event on browser s document untrusted The event don t do anything to verify the origin of the event so that bubbling up from the browser s content area will be as well to reproduce I tested with 0a1 nightly on Make sure that E10S is disabled with E10S from content won t bubble up to the browser Click the Pocket button to make sure that the extension is It t matter whether anything after that you don t need to sign up with Pocket Now open the attached in and click the Open about with Sync tab selected This button will open about sync page something that web normally cannot do Pop up blocker t affect this so can open any number of pop at any time this way Security don t apply either so opening arbitrary file chrome or about is possible Note that this only message that Pocket to There is a number of other message which might also have abuse potential e g message from Pocket Note also that the can detect when its attack was successful because the Pocket extension will remove the event target from the page Also this issue is completely avoidable There is only one Pocket frame in the browser document the event could be registered directly on that element rather than on the document this would make sure that no from other will be received

title: Paths received by FileSystemRequestParent need to be sanitized before passed to IsDescendantPath
description: Per discussion with baku on this is a follow up to a class bz bug link bz status RESOLVED bz closed show bug id title RESOLVED FIXED Privilege escape bug a Privilege escape The fix for needs to do some additional on the received from content and used in Initialize before they are to to prevent the trick Specifically in the parent the file picker could be used to select say to The child could later send a request for the path to my secret And would consider the second path to be a descendant of the first which would allow the content process to access that it should not be to The content process sandbox will soon block read access to arbitrary in the home directory

title: Non null terminated strings in crashreporter win cpp may potentially disclose memory
description: In toolkitcrashreporterclientcrashreporter win function a registry value is If the type is REG SZ i e a string it the content of a wchar t stack buffer to a object which is returned to the caller However in s document it us span class quote If the data the REG SZ REG MULTI SZ or REG EXPAND SZ type the string may not have been with the proper null Therefore even if the function ERROR SUCCESS the application should ensure that the string is properly before it otherwise it may overwrite a buffer span In our case because we don t the with all zero suppose the data we read is not null then the will contain the stack memory data which may include old value until it a NULL Whether this issue is exploitable on how the caller the object and what registry value it But no matter what not the string is null is problematic The doc to use function a uslibrarywindowsdesktopms724911 v rel uslibrarywindowsdesktopms724911 v a

title: Integer overflow leading to a buffer overflow in nsScriptLoadHandler
description: While loading external script data the following code is executed in uint8 t uint32 t bool int32 t char reinterpret cast char int32 t NS ENSURE SUCCESS uint32 t length uint32 t capacity if reserve capacity return NS ERROR OUT OF MEMORY Convert begin NS ENSURE SUCCESS MOZ ASSERT capacity produced more data than MOZ ALWAYS TRUE return NS OK The calculation of the new capacity at can overflow if enough data is sent by the server 4GB In that case the following call to reserve won t change the size of Afterwards Convert will write data past the end of the 8GB buffer char16 t python in the attached archive will trigger this condition and cause an access violation while writing data into an unmapped region following the buffer tested on and Aurora Process stopped thread tid 0x19afd5 0x0000000101c66c68 Convert char char16 t unavailable unavailable at queue apple main thread stop reason EXC BAD ACCESS code address 0x577000000 frame 0x0000000101c66c68 Convert char char16 t unavailable unavailable at for if 0xfffd NS ERROR ILLEGAL INPUT break frame 0x0000000101c66c68 Convert char char16 t unavailable unavailable at frame 0x0000000101c66c5f Convert this 0x0000000112a0e800 0x00007fff5fbfcc6c u 0x00007fff5fbfcc68 at frame 0x0000000102a5c3f2 this 0x00000001290eb740 unavailable unavailable at frame 0x0000000102a5be73 this 0x00000001290eb740 unavailable unavailable 0x00007fff5fbfccf4 at Some regarding It is possible to use compression to reduce the network load The attached code does that and thus only needs to send about 18MB of data It should be possible to place some behind the buffer as will usually allocate adjacent memory This could be done as The server the first 0xffffffff of the causing an allocation of an 8GB memory region code and lots of target At some point new memory is via which should be behind the 8GB buffer The server the data overflowing into the previously Due to page deduplication compression by the kernel it should be possible to trigger the bug while less than 8GB of available RAM At least on my Mac this to be the case as memory usage stays relatively low even during the A bit build of is so the bug can be triggered The data that is being written is not as it must be valid There is a special case when the capacity around to zero In that case the process will likely not crash as the overflow only inside the 8GB chunk

title: Race condition in PDF Viewer allows circumventing same origin policy for PDF files

title: Graphite2 FeatureRef applyValToFeature heap overflow
description: A graphite font with a specially feature table can cause a heap overflow which is exploitable to archive remote code execution The vulnerability in in the graphite library Before data to ensure that the capacity of the Vector is sufficient through a call to Vector reserve but it one too few because the variable m index is used for the call to Vector reserve and for the Vector data This to the possibility of a bit overflow because the vector is used as a bit map The attached work with a orgpubfirefoxreleases52 0linux x86 64en tar bz2 rel orgpubfirefoxreleases52 0linux x86 64en tar bz2 a and show the possibility to exploit the vulnerability to archive remote code execution poc1 the base address for the library poc2 with a jump to 0x4141414141414141

title: Addons update must verify IDs match between current and update versions
description: a vulnerability in the update process that a Man In The Middle attack to replace an with a fraudulent version The attacker needs to first obtain a valid signature for a fraudulent which can be done without review then hijack the call between the user and to replace the response from with the of the fraudulent This attack works because does not currently verify that the ID the ID this check will require the attacker to break into the service or steal the developer access to to sign a fraudulent with the same as the target The ID verification should be in a browser exposed anti privacy implantation at mass scale bd68e9eb1e95 ey0pm84bd rel browser exposed anti privacy implantation at mass scale bd68e9eb1e95 ey0pm84bd a

title: byte arbitrary file reads as SYSTEM with maintenance service
description: An unprivileged standard user can use the maintenance service to read the first of any file as the SYSTEM user Which t amazing but still better than nothing For example running the with arbitrary read C will return the first of the first line in the shell The full of can be seen in the C Program x86 Maintenance log file The root cause is that we can trick the maintenance service into reading an arbitrary file in by providing a update status where it one from the Even though the it to do so in such a way that it t the update status that we have prepared When the maintenance service goes to read the update status from the instead it the file as SYSTEM It then this to the log file which is world readable The buffer is only long so that s all we get out of the file If all are read the string t null so the memory past the end of the buffer is logged as well until it a null The proof of concept is a little bit rushed sorry although you can create a file as an unprivileged user I been trouble them without elevating Either elevating and removing the before the or a different directory should fix that The binary is a version from a testing rel testing a Tested on x64 as well as central a centralrev1d025ac534a6333a8170a59a95a8a3673d4028eetoolkitcomponentsmaintenanceserviceworkmonitor rel centralrev1d025ac534a6333a8170a59a95a8a3673d4028eetoolkitcomponentsmaintenanceserviceworkmonitor a a centralrev1d025ac534a6333a8170a59a95a8a3673d4028eetoolkitcomponentsmaintenanceserviceworkmonitor rel centralrev1d025ac534a6333a8170a59a95a8a3673d4028eetoolkitcomponentsmaintenanceserviceworkmonitor a

title: Privilege escalation Sandbox escape using PFileSystemRequestConstructor
description: Since we are in the process of rolling out a sandbox for each platform it is not only important to make it as tight as possible but also make sure that we don t have any unintended behavior that would allow to bypass the sandbox is probably going to be the first point of attack when trying to escalate from a content process Vulnerable Part I took a look at one particular message from the protocol due to its name The argument for that message is defined as span class quote union span Now looking at that protocol in more detail it is basically possible to bypass all of our file system in our sandbox no matter the platform currently write access to the file system is restricted on the latest nightly build However given a content process this restriction can be the above message I at one request in particular namely Now there are some security on the parent side but only for access However the critical part here is that no security whatsoever are for native file system access I e if the child a path like home user as part of it can write whatever it into that file since the file content to be written is with that message as well The is powerful enough to even allow This the path coming from the child if it t start with a object is and returned and as part of the constructor a member variable is set which unrestricted access Furthermore a last check before any operation is on the file path coming from the child here to a simple return true here Thus any file to be as long as the user that is running access This in itself is already a problem and ideally this message should be removed entirely or at least get a restriction on the parent side Privilege Since I to see if it is possible to gain code execution I decided to get a that would allow me to run arbitrary code with the parent Attached is a patch that to trigger the following some simple Compile with the patch applied Run and open some e g Open the web console Web Developer Web Console Run inside the web console window Directory path to file you want to When calling the message will be sent the channel to the parent the targeted file is as the first argument The content of the file is an ELF library that a constructor span class quote include h attribute constructor static void void LD PRELOAD LD LIBRARY PATH system id span I decided to overwrite one of the that are shipped with so because the parent process is probably to write in that directory where those reside and given a content process out where the root directory is is a trivial task So as a path I span class quote so span This the so and the next time is it will load that library and as part of the the constructor function is executed For test purpose I execute id will not be able to start but you will see the output of id on your terminal I decided to go with a library because it is probably the most reliable way but there may be other more clever ways to do it a title: Proxy Auto Config SSL TLS Url Disclosure
description: Description Proxy Auto Disclosure Affected All Category Information Disclosure Reporter Chapman and Stone of Context Information Security Summary Malicious Proxy Auto PAC allow for the disclosure of request full and query from The PAC file a function host which is for each request in order to determine the proxy for the connection This function the full and for both and which can be by a malicious PAC script This could expose search or any other data in query to based that would otherwise be This issue does not affect the default configuration of Analysis The PAC file is executed in a limited environment but some are still available see a rel a most notably This for the full request from affected to be to an attacker s server or local network via Since PAC must be manually either in or in the system proxy this issue would require a network based attacker to be able to intercept network traffic of a client with a PAC file For example this could be by a malicious gateway All that the PAC specification as written is affected by this issue We have confirmed this issue in a number of and operating Notably however Explorer does not leak full instead passing only the protocol and to the parameter of e g a example rel example a not a example foo bar rel example foo bar a Therefore a possible fix for this is to follow this same behaviour Proof of Concept A PAC script can be as below which will perform a based on the host and into the function function host if example replace a z0 return DIRECT return DIRECT This will perform with the against the example server See the following example from incoming telemetry submit telemetry 0b2fe929 bff9 9a77 9247930853db main release v example complete search client q secre example complete search client q secret example

title: ClearKeyDecryptor Integer Overflow Remote ZDI CAN
description: We received the following report from Micro s Zero Day Initiative CAN Integer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability HAu PI PA P VULNERABILITY Version Tested Nightly e677ba018b22 and general release bit Platform Tested Enterprise This is a patch of the vulnerability we originally to you as CAN in May The malicious value is found at offset 0x555 from the start of video1 m4s Relevant source code from clearkey0 1clearkeydecryptionmanager Status uint8 t uint32 t CK LOGD If the sample is split up into multiple we need to stitch them into one continuous buffer for vector uint8 t if Take all of and stitch them into one continuous buffer uint8 t data uint8 t iter for size t i i i data i uint32 t i if data Integer addition data may wrap around Trying to read past the end of the buffer the check return Status iter data BANG log to attachment CREDIT This vulnerability was discovered by Anonymous working with Trend Micro s Zero Day Initiative

title: Potential UAF in TLS server when verifying client authentication
description: This is a regression by a class bz bug link bz status RESOLVED bz closed show bug id title RESOLVED FIXED Don t require that the signature method for certificate verify is identical with support Bug a but I only it when I made some to the In handshake are calculated at the time they are The handshake are to include a pointer to the message buffer in the field pointer to hash input a orgnssrevb5e2bb64574eefa20a9143d908bd4e09a125070elibsslssl3con c rel orgnssrevb5e2bb64574eefa20a9143d908bd4e09a125070elibsslssl3con c a This is necessary because the need to cover the previous handshake message but not the current message Later in the same function the saved transcript is with the current message ssl3 UpdateHandshakeHashes is to add the current handshake message For this those to ssl3 which is an The problem is that if the handshake transcript the space available in the current buffer a new buffer will be This is fairly unlikely because the buffer is to MAX FRAGMENT LENGTH which is 18k However if the handshake transcript up and the client Certificate is almost 18k then this reallocation will occur when handling the as the total transcript goes over 18k The value of pointer to hash input is left pointing at a freed buffer and you get a when the handshake to verify the client s signature are calculated I only this because I sslBuffer Grow to start at a lower initial value and it The fix here is pretty simple I attached a patch I plan to land this as part of a bunch of other work which should hide the change however that is only on a branch currently and won t merge into proper for some time Kai do you think we need to land this in trunk or uplift it anywhere

title: Canvas filters allow feDisplacementMaps to be applied to cross origin images allowing timing attacks on them
description: See the last paragraph of a class bz bug link bz status RESOLVED bz closed show bug id c29 title RESOLVED FIXED global buffer overflow in bug comment a is only checked on the first draw after the filter was set If the canvas s state after that first draw we don t update the filter and happily apply This is bad because filter rendering can take different of time depending on the input and the input can be a cross origin image drawn through In the the stuff in the top left corner should be a black square not a black funny looking blob Chrome also this bug

title: Full local path of files is available to web pages after drag and drop
description: This bug was initially as a clone of a class bz bug link bz status RESOLVED bz closed show bug id title RESOLVED FIXED Outgoing are not Bug a Visit a org2016file rel org2016file a Drag and drop a file from Explorer or Nautilus into the web page You will see the full path of the dragged path The full path will be available via on and and probably OS X It will also be available via various other when dragged from Nautilus The content is completely by whereas Nautilus really x icon list list UTF8 STRING COMPOUND TEXT TEXT STRING the file will have for better or worse to disregard these in this case as to conform to the platform s Chrome to disregard all other if are provided during drag and drop It is questionable whether this path should be available to web content for privacy It also for further exploitation Disclosure of OS is the most easy and can help to exploit other as shown in a class bz bug link bz status RESOLVED bz closed show bug id c10 title RESOLVED FIXED Outgoing are not bug comment a For the input element it was considered a security bug a USsecurityadvisoriesmfsa2013 rel USsecurityadvisoriesmfsa2013 a web content might depend on this a possible use case would be an internal of dragged and from a network drive to track and automatically update them on Chrome does not expose the full path of to web in either case unsure about other dragging and dropping of so this is not really web compatible anyhow and I guess should not expose the either
